p: There are an estimated 3.2 million women who inject drugs worldwide, constituting 20% of all people who inject drugs [ 1]. Accounting for the concealing effects of criminalisation, gender power imbalances and stigma, this number is likely to be an underestimate [ 2]. The limited data that are available suggest that women who inject drugs are at greater risk of HIV and viral hepatitis acquisition than men who inject drugs [ 3]. This increased vulnerability is a product of a range of environmental, social and individual factors affecting women, which also affect their ability to engage in health promoting services such as harm reduction.
